comments.body: Is this not going to match `os.path.sep` in `_get_export_dir` and so in `test.get_temp_dir()`?

No, in this test we search correct delimiter between directory name and "`{`".
Error message formed by pattern "`SavedModel file does not exist at: %s%s{%s|%s}`" (in current version "`SavedModel file does not exist at: %s/{%s|%s}`").
For example, "`SavedModel file does not exist at: C:\IncorrectPathToSavedModel\{saved_model.pbtxt|saved_model.pb}`".
We are checking combination from delimiter and "`{`", path to temporary dir can't have this combination, it's simple test for correct path separator detection.
IMHO, this change can to be accepted without new tests, but I respect rules of project and created test for regression. For current "main" branch this test is red, for updated code - green, I think it's correct.
Excuse me if I incorrect understand your comment and give not valid answer, I want to make my code better, if I can.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +297,301 @@    with self.assertRaises(IOError) as err:
      loader_impl.parse_saved_model(path)
    self.assertTrue(pattern in str(err.exception))

if __name__ == "__main__":
